model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds Tiles, Sets Tile state during and after turns, Determines legal moves Tallies score

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Board getBoard()
      Returns a singleton Board with 64 Tiles
      java.util.LinkedList<int[]> getLegalMoves(Color player)
      Gets legal moves for current player
      int[] getScore()
      Tallies the score of the Board
      void playPiece(int location, Color player)
      Places a piece on the Tile in the given location of the color of the given player, and flips co-linear Tiles accordingly
      void reset()
      Resets the Board, setting all Tiles except the middle four empty, setting the middle four Tiles as specified by Othello variant, and emptying the player lists except for the initial Tiles.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()
        Returns a singleton Board with 64 Tiles
        Returns:
        the Board

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the Board, setting all Tiles except the middle four empty, setting the middle four Tiles as specified by Othello variant, and emptying the player lists except for the initial Tiles.

      • getLegalMoves

        public java.util.LinkedList<int[]> getLegalMoves(Color player)
        Gets legal moves for current player
        Parameters:
        player - The player to get legal moves for
        Returns:
        LinkedList with legal moves positions in format [x, y]

      • playPiece

        public void playPiece(int location,
                      Color player)
        Places a piece on the Tile in the given location of the color of the given player, and flips co-linear Tiles accordingly
        Parameters:
        location - Which Tile to play on
        player - Which player to play for

      • getScore

        public int[] getScore()
        Tallies the score of the Board
        Returns:
        Array containing Empty Tiles, Black Tiles, White Tiles respectively
